flawed_nl_solution:
He gets 30% off any book over $22 and he buys books that cost $25 and $35 so the total cost of these books is $25 + $35 = $<<25+35=60>>60
At 30% off, the discount on these books is $60*0.3 = $<<60*0.3=18>>18
That mean these 2 books will cost $60-$18 = $<<60-18=42>>42
He gets 20% off any book under $20 and he buys books for $18, $12 and $10 so these books together cost $18 + $12 + $10 = $40
at 20% off, the discount on these books is 40*0.2 = $8
So these 3 books will cost $40 - $8 = $<<40-8=23>>23
He has spent $42 on the two most expensive books, $23 on the 3 cheapest books, and also bought a book for $21, so his total comes to $42 + $23 + $21 = $<<42+23+21=86>>86
#### 86

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 23. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
